text: anyone here use [tree sitter](<https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter>)?  sounds pretty nuts

It's used by default in Atom IIRC and powers the goto reference feature on github. I've been thinking about whether it could be used to replace highlightjs on docs pages, but distributing the compiled parsers is a little tricky.

elements.text: It's used by default in Atom IIRC and powers the goto reference feature on github. I've been thinking about whether it could be used to replace highlightjs on docs pages, but distributing the compiled parsers is a little tricky.

text: I personally don't use it, but it is pretty interesting. Unforunately I couldn't use it for the problem I was working on :disappointed:. Worth noting there's also a Rust crate for it: <https://docs.rs/tree-sitter/0.19.3/tree_sitter/>
